website_summaries.verdict: This simple and inexpensive model meets EPA emission standards and is child safe.
pros: This model has a child safety feature
The second handle on the side helps you keep it steady as you pour
This price is for a 4 pack of the cans, which allows you to keep handy some gas premixed with oils, or to simply have some more gas on hand
cons: Has a no-spill spout, but we recommend buying a funnel to use with it

customer_reviews.title: Great Can - Terrible Spout (thank you CA & EPA)
customer_reviews.text: Great gas cans with well placed and sized handles. However, like all EPA rated gas cans, the nozzle system is stupid beyond belief. I immediately replaced them with Ez-Pour spouts and solid caps so I can avoid frustrating spills and needing multiple hands to simply pour gas from a can into a mower or generator. The solid caps are best for completely sealing the cans while in transit or storage.
customer_reviews.author: Ranger Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great Gas Can Now !
customer_reviews.text: I like the container, I replaced the spout, EPA requirement junk. I also added 1" chrome valve stems for a vent from ebay. works great now, just drill 1/2" hole for vent and add stem with rubber washer on outside!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I trashed the unusable California spout and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I trashed the unusable California spout and used the spout kit listed under the product. It includes a vent, which I installed. If you live in Komifornia you can't do this.I own 5 of these.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Laidig

customer_reviews.title: ... only gave it 3 stars is because of the stupid required spout that they put on these cans now
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I only gave it 3 stars is because of the stupid required spout that they put on these cans now. I realize that it's not the manufacturer but the government messing in our lives. These spouts spill more gas than the old versions. How I fixed the problem is to purchase other spouts online, install a yellow vent cap in a drilled hole and I've got a 5 star can.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super Dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these for a few months now. These are terribly dangerous to use. The spout burps gasoline in a glug glug way that causes it to splash all over if you are using a filter in your tank (common for generators). Get one of the old style that worked well forever.
customer_reviews.author: R. S.

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away!
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE... Item is not what is shown in the picture! I purchased these for the sturdy secure cap that screws on and has a tether so it cannot get lost. The cans sent to me had what looked like a flimsy flat cap that just sits on the end and can easily just fall off. I had to tie a string on the cap and fasten it to the spout so it doesn't get lost. STAY AWAY! Can maybe use the caps for BINGO discs.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: It's a well constructed can, which, after some major modifications, will serve it's purpose.
customer_reviews.text: You can't fault the manufacturer for compliance with the laws that render gas cans, dangerous, useless aggravations. If you add a vent and remove the 'fill impediment" tube inside the can, which can be accomplished with a skillful combination of a couple of forceps, a pair of pliers, scissors, getting your tongue in just the right position and the utterance of several dozen curse words, in the proper order. You should be able to figure it out from there but don't let the tube fall into the can unless you are a real glutton for punishment, which apparently, I am!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY. AWFUL DESIGN.
customer_reviews.text: the child safety system is not even close to being as easy as they claim in the video. the neck refuses to stay open unless you're pressing it hard against the lip of whatever you're filling with the can. there is no feature that let's the nozzle stay open while filling. fill time amazingly slow for the company making such great claims about how of a flow rate they have. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous buyer

customer_reviews.title: Product needs a warning.
customer_reviews.text: Placing a fine strainer in this container has created a safety hazard. In filling it from a gas pump the operator will be startled, and worse, could be injured by backsplashing gas caused by this restriction. This is advertised as a container to hold gas, not one to strain gas. There needs to be a warning to the uninitiated to either remove the strainer or expect to spend a lot of time being doused by gas in the attempt to fill it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hall

customer_reviews.title: I have no clue how this passed the rediclous CA laws which most likely caused a good product to fail
customer_reviews.text: Leaked, fumed, did not breathe when adjusting to temp changes. I have no clue how this passed the rediclous CA laws which most likely caused a good product to fail.
customer_reviews.author: Gage Hudson

customer_reviews.title: These EPA spouts suck! You will spill more than the old stile
customer_reviews.text: Throw the spout away and buy a replacement with a air vent sold on Amazon. Then you have a good working gas Can
customer_reviews.author: fred

customer_reviews.title: pour vent
customer_reviews.text: I wish they would have explained the pouring setup . It sucks. For a five gallon gas container you have to have 3 or 4 hands to hold it and then dodge the leakage . The container is okay the spout is useless .
customer_reviews.author: Mark.

customer_reviews.title: Love the double handle feature!
customer_reviews.text: These cans are great! The double handle design makes for an easy controllable pour, especially when the can is full. I replaced the spouts with Scepter spout kits P/N 3647 to avoid trying my patience (thanks, EPA). The plastic flexibility of the can allows expansion and contraction during temperature changes, preventing atmospheric oxygen from entering the can that oxidizes the fuel. Fuel stabilizer hasn't had any effect on the plastic. Seldom do I see local hardware stores with these double handle Midwest Cans, so ordering a four pack brought the price per can down and allows for a good quantity of fuel to be stored for the generator.
customer_reviews.author: margaret

customer_reviews.title: The strainer and spout are worthless
customer_reviews.text: Two handles are make it easy to handle but the bonehead at the EPA that designed the spout should be fired. There is more gas spilled now than there ever was when they had a flexible spout. The strainer that is installed makes it take forever to fill.
customer_reviews.author: Woodworker

customer_reviews.title: Can good spout junk.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these so I could stock up on gasoline for hurricane season. I do not like the design of the spout. the PLASTIC locking mechanism breaks easy if you are not careful pouring the gas into the tank. I should have investigated a little closer. I will have to find a different spout, these won't last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: H. Allen

customer_reviews.title: New style safety can with inside screen.
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this 4 pack so that I can lug ethanol free gasoline to my items that require ethanol free fuel. I also picked up a transfer pump. I knew these cans were the awful new style 'safety' cans that do not work well, what I didn't know is that these have a plastic screen inside that would effectively prevent me from using the transfer pump. After these were delivered, I immediately modified them for actual use. Thanks California and the US EPA for making gas cans (cough) 'safe'...
customer_reviews.author: Ben R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Simple
customer_reviews.text: Overall--very good. BUT---I would STRONGLY recommend a different discharge spout and adding a vent....I know it is not the manufactures fault (regulations) but I added a yellowfins event and I bought a different spout for my 4 gas cans and I'm much happy....These are a great place to start...
customer_reviews.author: Bmcgnh

customer_reviews.title: NOT DESIGNED FOR LONG TERM FUEL STORAGE.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect product for short time usage only. After having the gas cans for 2 years, the bonding glue or epoxy that holds the top together has dissolved and now leaks fumes and fluid. The search for a more reliable long term fuel storage solution continues.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Seam was split,causing leakage.
customer_reviews.text: Seam was split just below neck causing leakage. Didn't see until months after I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN R.

customer_reviews.title: Safety has drastically affected functionality
customer_reviews.text: Good size cans. The safety crap makes it frustrating to use. The internal screen makes filling it at the gas station a patience and anger control test. Hard to remove the screen and fill without tripping the overfill function of every gas pump, resulting in filling 5gallons at the slowest speed the pump can go.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy built
customer_reviews.text: I was going to downgrade the easy to use, but I realized they have to play by the idiotic EPA rules. After modifying the nozzle and adding a vent, these gas cans really are nice. The multiple handles allow one to hold them steadily and prevent spilling.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I hate the nozzle. They leak and are a pain to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No spill cap works great
customer_reviews.text: There are less and less marinas that sell fuel in my area. If you can find 1 gas is very pricey. I bought 4. They fit in my trunk. The no spill caps work great.
customer_reviews.author: Ed F

customer_reviews.title: Gas can
customer_reviews.text: I hate the safety feature in the can! Removed the safety tube within the can so I could get gas in there, what a pain. Five gallons of gas fills the can all the way to the spout, another pain! I like the can bc it has two handles, which is good for me bc I am not that strong anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Gartner

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I liked everything about these containers. They are what you can't find at retailers selling expensive containers with difficult to use safety devices that require 3 hands to operate. I bought 4 and going to buy 4 more.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Steckman

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Gas Cans
customer_reviews.text: I got the 4 pack and they make filling my lawnmower, generator and other small engines a breeze. I have had them over a year now and they have held up well. The spouts work great and keep from spilling when pouring. They also vent well with good gas flow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing a cap
customer_reviews.text: They look like good quality. I mean, they’re just gas cans. But one of mine was missing a cap. Kinda of a bummer but not a big enough deal to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Ok except for the insert
customer_reviews.text: Cans are fine except for the white inserts, couldn’t fill the cans I had to remove them. Two came out but two fell into the can. Needs to be redesigned so that you can fill the can and still have the flow restrictions. I know what I’m talking about I’m an engineer.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Davidson

customer_reviews.title: Seams Splitting at handle
customer_reviews.text: Have had gas stored off and on since 2016. Not much handling...noticed today seams are splitting on top handle...never seen a gas can do this...was there a recall I missed?
customer_reviews.author: Glenn M.

customer_reviews.title: Not too impressed!
customer_reviews.text: The cans are decent quality but the spouts are a pain in the butt to use. Very cumbersome and not durable at all. I have broken Teo already and one of the rubber seals already has a tear. I purchased an electric transfer pump and now just use the cans, no longer screwing around with the spouts.
customer_reviews.author: Peter D Rozin

customer_reviews.title: Great Can But Bad Spout Design
customer_reviews.text: The can itself is great but the spouts are a pain to use. Trying to keep the red spring loaded part pulled back while trying to hold the can at the right angle at the same time have much to be desired, not to mention the flow is extremely slow which extends the battle time fighting the spout. Whoever designed this spout obviously did not actually use it much.
customer_reviews.author: veeray

customer_reviews.title: Hate spill proof spout
customer_reviews.text: I just hate the "spill proof" spout, I bought ones to go on it that are not spill proof and I spill less that with em. Someone has to come up with a better way
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact I can actually lift these when they're full of fuel. I don't like the new, modern spouts; they are difficult and inconvenient to use.
customer_reviews.author: TheWyzOldOwl

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful and good handling
customer_reviews.text: I use the gas can's for the spare gas for my boat. Easy handling and they are tide. no spill!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Oesterheld

customer_reviews.title: nice thick cans, don't leak.
customer_reviews.text: had to buy these after we had a land hurricane called derecho. Easy to use, no leaks. I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Nice Five-Gallon Gas Containers.  Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Nice Five-Gallon Gas Containers. Made in USA. I never use the lousy spouts all gas can manufacturer's give you these days. I always drill a hole and add a vent cap to the back. Then I replace the spout with a regular screw cap (EZ Spout yellow cap).
customer_reviews.author: Canis Domum

customer_reviews.title: Nice cans!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to handle and pour. The nozzle works much, much better than other cans.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Nozzle leaks gas EVERYWHERE!
customer_reviews.text: Holds gas well but when I poor into car fuel tank they leak EVERYWHERE. I will have to purchase new nozzles.
customer_reviews.author: Davidss03

customer_reviews.title: Nice, quality gas can.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, quality cans. The spouts are a little hard to operate, especially when wearing heavy gloves, but not all that hard. The handle, lower down on the side, makes it easy to control while filling a mower or other equipment.
customer_reviews.author: awsum140

customer_reviews.title: A poorly design and poorly made product.
customer_reviews.text: 3 of the 4 spouts have broken off. When I use the replacements or the remaining original, it's impossible to avoid spilling fuel everywhere. A poorly design and poorly made product.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Horrible spout
customer_reviews.text: Horrible horrible horrible spout. The spring loaded spout has to be pressed in to pour. And even then, it's slow. I would only buy this if you were planning on replacing the spout.
customer_reviews.author: William S. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: The safety cap is so safe that I couldn't use. Had to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spout is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I’m only giving this 2 stars because of the value but the new spout design on these are terrible. They are supposed to be safer but they leak all over the place when pouring them. The handles and actual can are durable but the spout ruins the whole product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: a gas can!
customer_reviews.text: Yep - it's a gas can. it holds gas. It's a solid piece of plastic and easy to hold and pour. And it's a pretty red color!
customer_reviews.author: J.Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: If you purchase these gas cans, you will need to swap the spouts and add a vent to safety use
customer_reviews.text: The gas cans themselves are very good, it's the spouts that make these unusable. I subsequently purchased additional spouts and vents, which now allows me to safely use these cans.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Dinesen

customer_reviews.title: Embassadors of ALOHA
customer_reviews.text: You guys are awesome!! I wish I could write you personally and thank you for over nighting here too is before the hurricane hit!!! ALOHA
customer_reviews.author: Hawaii

customer_reviews.title: Better design needed
customer_reviews.text: Cans are decent. Spout is striaght so not easy to pour. I would look for ones with curved spouts next time.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Hutzler

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Overall I am very happy they are a lot more durable than I thought based on the price but I now have all my hurricane back up fuel stored away satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Bulk buy is better.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the cans and pour spouts is good. Buying in bulk helped with savings.
customer_reviews.author: PawpawAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work great when modified
customer_reviews.text: Great cans once you install a vent and use a high flow spout.
customer_reviews.author: Larry J Eastin

customer_reviews.title: Good quality can, but horrible nozzle.
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the can is fantastic, but the nozzle is not good. It spills everywhere due to a horrible tip design. Still worth the money versus gas cans found in local stores. This was half the price!
customer_reviews.author: J. Biron

customer_reviews.title: Best Gas Can on Market
customer_reviews.text: Meets expectations. Dual handles make it easy to pour without spilling. Spill prof nozzle is far superior to earlier models and is easy to use. Container expands and balloons out when left in sun indicating a completely sealed container that is not venting hydro-carbons. This is an excellent product and worth the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: Little Lock

customer_reviews.title: Save your money. Keep looking.
customer_reviews.text: Worst Amazon purchase ever! They are not Midwest cans and all 4 of them leak from the spout. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Nevada Rob

customer_reviews.title: Great Cans when you replace the spouts
customer_reviews.text: Nice sturdy cans. The spouts are terrible. Do yourself a favor and buy EZ-Pour spouts
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy J Harper

customer_reviews.title: Great Gas Can Design
customer_reviews.text: Well designed and easy to handle, these cans are just what I was looking for to match several older ones I already had. The dual handles really make it easier to pour when heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Holds gas
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for hurricane season in florida. Haven't had to use them yet but seem well made
customer_reviews.author: Allen Timlake

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Product description was perfect, price was perfect and delivery was perfect. A perfect transaction...
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: I'm Sure the EPA Had Something to Do With the Operation of the Spout
customer_reviews.text: Read the instructions if you're not familiar with the operation of the spout or you'll want to end your life while trying to hold this upside down and figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C.

customer_reviews.title: good cans for value
customer_reviews.text: I don't have the leaking problems others are having. One suggestion would be to keep the nozzle separate and get a stand alone cap. Because the only leaking is when taking the nozzle out of the gas some gets caught in the little screw on cap at the very top of the nozzle.
customer_reviews.author: C. T. Haraburda

customer_reviews.title: but the two handles make it easy to use and pour when full
customer_reviews.text: it's a gas can, but the two handles make it easy to use and pour when full. undecided about the fuel spout press-to-pour design.
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cans
customer_reviews.text: I have read in the reviews that some people complain of leakage while using these cans. I now have 8 of them and have not had this issue with any of them. I plan to get 4 more. I figure you can never have to many living in a Hurricane prone area.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Best price
customer_reviews.text: I've looked all over and this is the best price I've found.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lindau

customer_reviews.title: Great can but terrible spout/cap
customer_reviews.text: Great can but terrible spout/cap. Another government blunder that rather then reducing gas fumes will actually increase gas spills and pollution. This is definitely a bad regulation the Trump administration should roll back.
customer_reviews.author: wzehrung

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Haven't tried the nozzle so many have complained about - but the container itself is an excellent value. Using container for storage. Purchased one free-flow nozzle to move from can to can when pouring into mower.
customer_reviews.author: U2

customer_reviews.title: GOOD
customer_reviews.text: I LIKE THE WAY THIS WORKS .FILLS UP A STANDARD MOWE IN ABOUT 1,5 SECONDS STOPS WHEN FULL. I BOUGHT THE 4 PACK FOR HURRICANE SEASON AND GENERATOR USE.
customer_reviews.author: HONOR

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good so far, alittle hard to get the rest of gas out of can and into my car.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wendling

customer_reviews.title: Best 5 gallon can
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use with the back hand grip. Put the gas nozzles replacement kit on it and you have a good gas can.
customer_reviews.author: mesquiteguy

customer_reviews.title: Great for "just in case".
customer_reviews.text: Got these when Michael was on it's way. Glad to have durable fuel cans on hand. Would buy from again.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Glab

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived on time and is exactly as described.
customer_reviews.author: MRCPA

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase for generator
customer_reviews.text: Best value i could find for the amount and size of containers. I got these for my generator during hurricane season when power tends to go out for a day or two at a time.
customer_reviews.author: James Mellon

customer_reviews.title: It holds gas as expected
customer_reviews.text: It's just a gas can and it holds gas just fine. I replaced the spout with one that works. 5 stars because it's not their fault the government mandated this stupid spout.
customer_reviews.author: West Texas

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Bought pack of 4 great quality Preparation for Hurricane Season
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J.

customer_reviews.title: Get 'em now!
customer_reviews.text: Quickly shipped and delivered as advertised. Especially important since Irma had cleared out the supply of these puppies!
customer_reviews.author: jdl123

customer_reviews.title: Nozzles actually work
customer_reviews.text: Really glad I bought these. They shipped with a newer nozzle than the one pictured—Had to watch a YouTube video in order to use the nozzle because it confused me. Overall no issues with the safety nozzle, the flow was very fast for filling a generator. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lapping

customer_reviews.title: These lawyerized tops are better than some others but still suck
customer_reviews.text: These lawyerized tops are better than some others but still suck. I wish we could still get the old simple non-"anti-spill" blitz ones. All the new "anti-spill" tops are basically guaranteed spill tops.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bostley

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for these type can's for months, they are sturdy, the side handle is perfect for when you have to pour gas in a car.
customer_reviews.author: David McGrew

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's a gas can. It works as a gas can should!!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: Meets all expectations. Holds up very well during temperature changes, 70 at night to 105 day, some expansion but no leaks or burst seams.
customer_reviews.author: gunner

customer_reviews.title: Can collapses
customer_reviews.text: The can dispenses fuel fine. But the can collapses when it sits. The plastic is hard and can gets distorted. Very bad design.
customer_reviews.author: William Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not to hip aboput the nozzel on it but it does not leak
customer_reviews.author: Razorback

customer_reviews.title: Good deal not a good design but none are anymore
customer_reviews.text: Pour spout sucks. needs vent or will take about 20 min to empty. gasket is of questionable quality but worked so far.
customer_reviews.author: Freeradical

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Much more durable than a major retailers brand gas can. Pour spout unusable but that's more due to federal requirements.
customer_reviews.author: eniram

customer_reviews.title: Nice cans!
customer_reviews.text: Love them! Spout is stored inside can for easy storage!
customer_reviews.author: J Smith

customer_reviews.title: Super fast shipping!!
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality cans. Spouts are all horrible anymore but these are better than most. Amazingly fast shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Ben J Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought it coz we may need in the future, honestly, I thought these were slightly expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Manvin

customer_reviews.title: Good cans, good deal.  Very fast delivery
customer_reviews.text: Good set of cans for holding 20 gallons of fuel in reserve. Seem sturdy enough. Didn't leak at the spout when I tested by laying them down full on a piece of cardboard for an hour.
customer_reviews.author: Picard321

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this gas can because it has two handles for holding----one on top and one on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tricky to Use
customer_reviews.text: These are reasonable cans but regulations make them use spout designs that make them hard to use. Reasonable value on these, but frustrated with spout design.
customer_reviews.author: PJM

customer_reviews.title: The can is great but the nozzles are the really horrible EPA junk
customer_reviews.text: The can is great but the nozzles are the really horrible EPA junk, I knew that so got the old time ones you have with vents so it 's just like the old days, they work. It was hard finding ones with the handle on the back, without that they would be useless like the rest of them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Its a gas can. The handle on the side is nice
customer_reviews.author: Bbq guy

customer_reviews.title: It is what was advertised.
customer_reviews.text: It's a gas can ..... Hate the new safety spouts,. But what are you going to do ? Shipping was fast and I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: B. Steve Smock

customer_reviews.title: With the correct nozzle and vent, these are the best you can buy...
customer_reviews.text: We all know the new EPA laws make these cans terrible and, frankly, dangerous. But that's not the mfg's fault. That is poor, improperly hashed-out legislation. HOWEVER, there are aftermarket nozzles and the good ol' vent caps available. Granted, it's extra money, but it's the only way gas cans can be any good any more. So go get the yellow cap nozzles and yellow vents and install on this can. Then, you have a smooth-flowing double-handled gas can that is 100% perfectly fine.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality but prefer the tall, slim container. It will do.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H

customer_reviews.title: Stupid spring loaded safety crap
customer_reviews.text: I really hate those spring safety things, they cause more spillage than not having one, the can itself is fine...
customer_reviews.author: MikeTrike

customer_reviews.title: Best can I have tried.
customer_reviews.text: Will not smell of gas in the car. Best can I have bought.
customer_reviews.author: Juan G. Ugueto

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pour spout is hard to operate and restricts gas flow coming out of can
customer_reviews.author: EARL RICHARD 111

customer_reviews.title: Good Gas Can!
customer_reviews.text: Only drawback is the spout is always out, but the filler valve makes it much easier to avoid spills.
customer_reviews.author: JoBro

customer_reviews.title: Great can horrible EPA spout
customer_reviews.text: Great can horrible EPA spout. Replace Spout with EZ Pour spout kit and then you have a can that works.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Kolar

customer_reviews.title: I hate the EPA nozzles and always end up spilling gas ...
customer_reviews.text: Same gas cans you buy at the store but at a little cheaper price point, I hate the EPA nozzles and always end up spilling gas somehow. I change them out to the EZpour Nozzles, an extra $10-12 per can but soooooo worth it in time, gas not being spilt and pure frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Crane

customer_reviews.title: GAS FOR MY GENERATOR
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 6 pack as I can no longer lift a 5 gallon jug due to a back injury. High quality materials and finish well worth the price. However, the OEM Federally mandated spout is hard to work. I have a generator and it is difficult not to spill gas...that's dangerous when working with hot equipment. This is not the manufacturers fault as even the mandated spout is of high quality. Whoever designed this spout never had to work with hot equipment i.e. lawnmower, generator. I purchased a high quality spout over Amazon made by Combined Mfg. and additional vents made by scriber plastics. NOW everything works well without spillage..
customer_reviews.author: J. Finnegan

product_meta.title: Midwest Can 5600-4PK Gas Can - 5 Gallon Capacity, (Pack of 4)
product_meta.description: Size:5 Gallon, (Pack of 4)Made of durable HDPE with barrier materials to virtually eliminate hydrocarbon emissions. Holds 5 gallons (20 liters) of gas and oil mixes and exceeds California Air Resource Board (CARB) and EPA requirements for portable fuel containers. This can is designed with two handles for easier use and handling. In addition this can is built with a wider base and lower center of gravity to reduce the chance of a can tipping over and if it does, the spouts close automatically with an airtight seal.
feature_bullets: Exceeds California Air Resource Board (CARB) and EPA requirements for portable fuel containers
Holds 5 gallons of gas and oil mixes
Two handles for easier use and handling
